reviews.text: I have visited many time but had dinner recently and was extremely disappointed with food and service.
reviews.title: Excellent setting but poor food and service
Nice Setting and Good Food
reviews.text: The menu should be something you look at and have several choices, I looked at menu and was finding it difficult to find something I wanted to order, I know that individuals have varying opinions but along with my wife we thought menu poor.

reviews.title: Anniversary dinner
reviews.text: The waiter who took our order was very off hand, when I ordered haggis I asked if I would need a side order or was it a large enough portion, he replied it depends how hungry you are. He assured me it was a large plateful, But It wasnt it was more like a starter plateful...

reviews.title: First Class, Historic Wedding Venue
reviews.text: The food service for the first two courses was probably to quick if thats possible, we had our starter on the table almost as quick as we took off our overjackets, although the soup doesnt take too long to serve.
After our main plates were removed by the same "nice" waitor he asked if we wanted the desert menu, we said yes but after waiting 20 mins we had to shout him over to remind him.
reviews.title: Was disappointed tonight!
Average food but lovely hotel
reviews.text: Although a lovely hotel the food was very average, service was great though and still a pleasant evening

reviews.title: Perfect dining experience
reviews.text: Staying locally we ate here twice and both times the food, ambiance and service was absolutely superb. Two really memorable meals

reviews.title: Our favourite retreat..
reviews.text: We have been going to the Brig-o-doon for as long as we have been together and always find the lunchtime/early evening meal of great value. The staff and atmosphere add to the whole burns theme experience with there charming chat and occasional appearence of the compiere if your lucky enough to see a wedding or be at one! The wedding experience is undoubtedly the best we have ever had as the grounds and iconic brig-o-doon over the river provides scenery to die for in photos etc...

reviews.title: Quality service and setting
reviews.text: A great family day out for lunch or dinner with a fabulous atmosphere. If you get the glorious Ayrshire weather then be sure to sit by the river with a glass of wine and chill....

You cannot fail to impress at Brig o'Doon Hotel - the setting, particularly in the summer if outside in the gardens, is one of the best. Weekends are always busy, as wellas mid-week dining, and the weddings which are a popular reason for choosing here (ask to see the bedrooms on site - only 6 of them) are well separated from the casual dining areas. Parking is non-existent immediately outside the Hotel so you may need to walk up to 300yds.
reviews.title: The highlight of our trip to Scotland
An interesting place to see
reviews.text: I had a dinner here with several colleagues last week. It was my first visit. Located next to the home of Robert Burns this hotel is in a beautiful setting with lots of old world charm. The food however is somewhat average. I had a tomato soup that was a bit tinny, and a shepherds pie that tasted like lasagna. The service was average. Not a bad choice and maybe even a good choice in south Ayrshire.

reviews.title: A favourite haunt
reviews.text: The location and the hotel are beautiful so it is not surprising it is a favourite venue for weddings, which in itself provides a great atmosphere and entertainment as you can inspect the procession of spectacular outfits worn by the wedding parties! On one occasion we were asked to move twice after being seated but the manager was quick to mollify us with a complimentary glass of champers so we forgave him! We´ve always found the food excellent and so well presented! The staff are courteous and well trained. Definitely a favourite place for an all-round experience!

reviews.title: ice creams
reviews.text: Took the children in for ice-creams, although they seem expensive they're really nice.
My hubby and I had a cream too, also very good!
reviews.title: Lovely setting and good, decent food.
What a beautiful hotel.
reviews.text: The gardens are beautiful and really well kept. Plenty of seating outside if the sun shines!

reviews.title: Enjoyable Meal in well run hotel restaurant
reviews.text: I had an excellent meal in this hotel. I hadn't booked in advance but this didn't cause any problem as I had arrived early before the hotel became busy. I was shown downstairs to the restaurant by the receptionist who offered to take my jacket.

reviews.title: Alloway's best
reviews.text: There was a choice of 3 different menus. The early evening one which was available from 5pm until 6.30pm. Then there was the chef's specials and finally the main menu.

reviews.title: Disappointment
reviews.text: While awaiting my starter I was offered some delicious home made bread. The salmon starter was excellent as was the main course of pork. I also enjoyed the dessert. There was plenty of choice in all three menus.

My meal came to just over £24. This included 3 courses, 2 soft drinks, a pot of tea which included a pot of hot water. 2 pieces of home made fudge was also included. I don't normally like fudge as I find it too sweet but not this time. I could only manage to eat one piece as I was too full.
reviews.title: Don't have a food allergy
Always Very Good
reviews.text: As I was on my own I was able to observe the staff and customers in the restaurant and noticed that the staff worked well as a team. They all appeared very happy in their work. There was no bickering between them. When a customer requested extra bread they were only too happy to help. Empty plates were taken away promptly. The restaurant began to get busy but the staff continued giving the same excellent service. I wasn't made to feel uncomfortable being on my own as happens in some places. I was treated in the same way as the other guests.
